entry.summary: OPINION & ORDER re: (727 in 1:25-md-03143-SHS-OTW) JOINT LETTER MOTION for Discovery Concerning Plaintiffs Rule 30(b)(6) Notices addressed to Magistrate Judge Ona T. Wang from Andrew S. Bruns, Davida Brook, Justin A. Nelson dated November 5, 2025. filed by OpenAI OpCo LLC, OpenAI Inc., OpenAI LP, OpenAI Global LLC, OpenAI LLC, OpenAI Holdings LLC, OpenAI GP, LLC, OAI Corporation, LLC. Accordingly, for the foregoing reasons, OpenAI's request for a protective order is DENIED. The language "high-level" should be stricken from Topic 1, and the remaining disputed language should be retained for Topics 2 - 9. The Clerk of Court is respectfully directed to close ECF Nos. 727 and 747. SO ORDERED. (Signed by Magistrate Judge Ona T. Wang on 11/24/2025) Filed In Associated Cases: 1:25-md-03143-SHS-OTW et al. (rro) (Entered: 11/24/2025)

entry.title: Entry #782 in Authors Guild v. OpenAI Inc., 1:23-cv-08292
entry.summary: OPINION & ORDER RE: OPENAI'S DELETION OF BOOKS1 AND BOOKS2 DATASETS AND PRIVILEGE RULINGS (ECF NOS. 413, 428, 479, 481, 504, 505, 615, 616) re: (226 in 1:24-cv-00084-SHS-OTW, 413 in 1:25-md-03143-SHS-OTW, 99 in 1:25-cv-03291-SHS-OTW, 138 in 1:25-cv-03483-SHS-OTW, 568 in 1:23-cv-08292-SHS-OTW, 534 in 1:25-cv-03482-SHS-OTW, 456 in 1:23-cv-10211-SHS-OTW) LETTER MOTION to Compel OpenAI to Produce Materials Over Which OpenAI Claims Privilege Regarding the Reasons for Deletion of These Materials addressed to Magistrate Judge Ona T. Wang from Justin A. Nelson dated July 30, 2025. filed by Junot Diaz, Rich Cohen, OpenAI GP LLC, Sides Hampton, Christina Baker Kline, Simon Winchester, MICHAEL CHABON, OpenAI Startup Fund I LP, Sarah Silverman, Mary Bly, LIPPMAN LAURA, Paul Tremblay, OpenAI, LLC, Matthew Klam, DAVID HENRY HWANG, Jonathan Franzen, Richard Kadrey, OpenAI GP LLC, Dario Amodei, OpenAI Global LLC, Michael Chabon, Julian Sancton, Elin Hilderbrand, Junot Daz, Eugene Linden, Reuters News & Media Inc, OAI Corporation, LLC, OpenAI, Inc., Christopher Golden, Nicholas Basbanes, Laura Lippman, Roxana Robinson, AYELET WALDMAN, George Saunders, Authors Guild, Richard Kadrey, OpenAI Startup Fund GP I LLC, OpenAI LP, Rachel Louis Snyder, Hampton Sides, Jodi Picoult, OpenAI Holdings LLC, James Shapiro, Douglas Preston, Andrew Sean Greer, Kai Bird, JUNOT DAZ, OpenAI LLC, JACQUELINE WOODSON, Michael Connelly, David Baldacci, Microsoft Corporation, George R.R. Martin, ANDREW SEAN GREER, Rachel Louise Snyder, Ta-Nehisi Coates, Jacqueline Woodson, Microsoft Corporation, Lippman Laura, Rachel Vail, ANDREW SEAN GREER, MATTHEW KLAM, Taylor Branch, Christopher Golden, OpenAI Inc., Nicholas Ngagoyeanes, Maya Shanbhag Lang, OpenAI Startup Fund Management LLC, The Center for Investigative Reporting, Inc., Stacy Schiff, Ayelet Waldman, Jonathan Alter, RACHEL LOUISE SNYDER, OAI Corporation LLC, OpenAI GP, LLC, David Henry Hwang, Jia Tolentino, OpenAI OpCo LLC, John Grisham, Sylvia Day, Sarah Silverman, OpenAI Holdings, LLC, TA-NEHISI COATES, Victor LaValle, Daniel Okrent, Scott Turow. For the foregoing reasons, Class Plaintiffs' motion to compel is GRANTED in part with respect to privilege waiver and DENIED in part with respect to the crime-fraud exception. OpenAI is directed to produce forthwith the communications that the Court reviewed in camera (Log Nos. 14, 15, 17, and 18), and all other written communications with in-house counsel in 2022 regarding the reasons for the deletion of (a) the Books1 and Books2 datasets and (b) all internal references to LibGen that OpenAI has redacted or withheld on the basis of attorney-client privilege. OpenAI is further directed to log all written communications regarding the same to the extent they are not already on OpenAI's privilege log, and to identify on its privilege log the specific communications that relate to the deletion of (a) and (b) above. OpenAI's production must be completed by December 8, 2025. Further, because OpenAI's 30(b)(6) deponent testified that OpenAI's counsel participated in oral communications regarding the deletion of the Books1 and Books2 datasets and OpenAI asserted attorney-client privilege over these communications, (see ECF 413-1 at 97-98), Class Plaintiffs are entitled to depose OpenAI's in-house lawyers on such communications and their personal knowledge after OpenAI has produced the written communications described above. Given OpenAI's ongoing improper privilege assertions, Class Plaintiffs are entitled to depositions of up to 2 hours for each OpenAI attorney who participated in such communications in 2022, which will not count against the total deposition hours cap previously set by the Court. OpenAI is directed to identify the OpenAI attorneys by December 5, 2025, and make them available for these depositions no later than December 19, 2025. The Clerk of Court is respectfully directed to close ECF 413. (Signed by Magistrate Judge Ona T. Wang on 11/24/2025) Filed In Associated Cases: 1:25-md-03143-SHS-OTW et al. (rro) (Entered: 11/24/2025)
